subject: Cruisecontrol and Junit Test Intergration
msgSnippet: Hi All, I get the following error: D:/oldwork/checkout/MY_PROJECT_1/build.xml:35: Could not create task or type of type: junit. In my web application of CC.
messageBody:
Hi All,

I get the following error:

D:/oldwork/checkout/MY_PROJECT_1/build.xml:35: Could not create task
or type of type: junit.

In my web application of CC.

build-MY_PROJECT_1.xml:

<project name="build-MY_PROJECT_1" default="build"
basedir=".">
<target name="build">
<!-- Get the latest from CVS -->
<cvs cvsroot=":local:D:/src/master" package="MY_PROJECT_1"
dest="checkout" failonerror="true"/>
<!-- Call the target that does everything -->
<ant antfile="MY_PROJECT_1/build.xml" dir="checkout" target="build-
everything"/>
<!-- Creating TODAY_DATE time stamp for taging CVS version -->
<tstamp>
<format property="TODAY_DATE" pattern="yyyyMMdd-hhmmss"
locale="en"/>
</tstamp>
<!-- Creating a Tag for CVS version -->

<cvs cvsRoot=":local:D:/src/master"
command="tag Sporty2BuildRelease${TODAY_DATE}" failonerror="true"
dest="checkout"/>
</target>
</project>

**********************************************************************
******************************
**********************************************************************
******************************
build.xml:

<project basedir="." default="build-everything" name="build">


<!-- ****************************************************
Define the project classpath references. Any jar found
in lib directory will be included in CLASSPATH
**************************************************** -->
<path id="project.classpath" >
<fileset dir=".">
<include name="junit.jar"/>
<include name="optional.jar"/>
<include name="ant.jar"/>
</fileset>
</path>
<!-- **************************************************** -->
<!-- Define the runtime classpath references -->
<!-- **************************************************** -->
<path id="project.runtime.classpath" >
<path refid="project.classpath" />
<pathelement location="MY_PROJECT_1" />
<pathelement path="${java.class.path}"/>
</path>


<target name="compile" >
<javac source="1.4" debug="true"
deprecation="true"
destdir="MY_PROJECT_1"
srcdir="MY_PROJECT_1" >
<classpath refid="project.classpath"/>
</javac>
</target>

<target name="runtest" depends="compile" >
<junit fork="yes" haltonfailure="yes" printsummary="on" >
<classpath >
<path refid="project.runtime.classpath" />
</classpath>
<formatter type="xml"/>
<test name="HelloWorldTest" haltonfailure="on"/>
</junit>
</target>


<target name="build-everything" depends="runtest" />

</project>

**********************************************************************
**********************************************************88
**********************************************************************
*******************88888
My directory Structure:


oldwork
|-----artifacts
|
|
|----checkout
| |
| |MY_PROJECT1
| |
| | -Which has all
the code and and classes files
| and ant.jar,
junit.jar, optional.jar
|
|
|----log

**********************************************************************
********************************
**********************************************************************
********************************
confiq.xml:

<cruisecontrol>
<project name="MY_PROJECT_1" buildafterfailed="false">
<!-- Bootstrappers are run every time the build runs,
*before* the modification checks -->
<bootstrappers>
<currentbuildstatusbootstrapper
file="logs/MY_PROJECT_1/buildstatus.txt"/>
</bootstrappers>
<!-- Defines where cruise looks for changes,
to decide whether to run the build -->
<modificationset quietperiod="5">
<cvs localworkingcopy="checkout/MY_PROJECT_1"/>
</modificationset>
<!-- Configures the actual build loop,
how often and which build file/target -->
<schedule interval="3">
<ant buildfile="build-MY_PROJECT_1.xml" target="build"
uselogger="true" usedebug="true"/>
</schedule>
<!-- directory to write build logs to -->
<log dir="logs/MY_PROJECT_1" encoding="ISO-8859-1">
<merge dir="checkout" />
<merge file="checkout/MY_PROJECT_1/build/checkstyle.xml"/>
</log>
<!-- Publishers are run *after* a build completes -->
<publishers>
<htmlemail mailhost="wamu.net"
css="D:\cruisecontrol-2.1.1\cruisecontrol-2.1.1
\reporting\jsp\css\cruisecontrol.css"
xsldir="D:\cruisecontrol-2.1.1\cruisecontrol-2.1.1
\reporting\jsp\xsl"
logdir="logs/MY_PROJECT_1"
returnaddress="rauf.saleem@..."
buildresultsurl="http://localhost/cc/buildresults/MY_PROJECT_1"
skipusers="true" spamwhilebroken="true">
<always address="rauf.saleem@..."/>
<always address="dev2@..."/>
<failure address="rauf.saleem@..."/>
</htmlemail>

<artifactspublisher
dir="D:\cruisecontrol-2.1.1\cruisecontrol-2.1.1\main"
dest="artifacts/MY_PROJECT_1"/>
<currentbuildstatuspublisher
file="logs/MY_PROJECT_1/buildstatus.txt"/>
</publishers>

<!-- External cruise "plugins" used by this project (none needed) -->
<plugin name="artifactspublisher"

classname="net.sourceforge.cruisecontrol.publishers.ArtifactsPublisher
"/>
</project>
</cruisecontrol>

**********************************************************************
*****************8
**********************************************************************
*******************
I am using CC 2.1.1 version, Please provide some advise, I have spend
like 8 hours on this, and tried evrything I could think of . Please
provide some feedback if you ran into the
issue. All replys will appericated!

Thanks,
Tom Wagner
